projects.description: A simple web app that shows a random quote from a small list of mostly historical quotes read by Leonard Nimoy in the game Civilization 4. Quotes and colors are chosen at random. A new quote and color is also displayed after a set interval.

A simple web app to demonstrate pagination. This app displays a static list of user profiles on pages by dynamically generating the HTML element objects. It also supports substring search results, which are also paginated.

A simplified mock checkout menu form for a technology conference, including the purchasing of possible swag, access to specific speaker sessions, and supporting different payment methods. Handles multiple types of user inputs, conditional logic for checkout flows, and form validation for checkout.
A simple game webapp that uses OOP and manages state (without using React) to let a user guess letters up to 5 times for a randomly chosen phrase.

An app that uses the public API for Random User Generator to demonstrate some basic js concepts, such as fetch, conditional user handling, modal displays, and the cycling between users on the current page.
